conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible top+side faces, angled/isometric camera, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong wall extrusion, readable corners, and clear cutaway. Minor simplification of some wall junction detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches (activity area + balcony on left, bedroom wing to right, central hall). Some room proportion/partition placement appears simplified, and one bedroom’s identity/furnishing is ambiguous compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and basic living furniture present; bathroom has key fixtures. One bedroom appears under-furnished/unclear versus the 2D plan (missing/unclear bed/robe representation).

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good readability of walls/floors/openings. Monochrome materials reduce differentiation of doors/windows slightly but geometry remains clear.

detected_errors.description: One bedroom (corresponding to Bed 3 in the 2D plan) is not clearly furnished/identified (bed/robe not clearly represented), reducing room identity verification confidence.
Some partitions and room proportions appear simplified relative to the 2D plan (linen/robe/bath-WC detailing not perfectly matched).
Door/window placement and opening sizes look generally consistent but not exact (some openings appear generalized).

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong volumetric walls and broadly faithful layout, but with noticeable simplification and one bedroom’s furnishing/identity not clearly matching the 2D plan.
